Ahead of the shock the gas is at rest with pressure p1p_{1}p1​ and density ρ1\rho_{1}ρ1​, while behind the shock the velocity, pressure and density of the gas are u2,p2u_{2}, p_{2}u2​,p2​ and ρ2\rho_{2}ρ2​ respectively. Now consider a change of frame such that the shock is stationary and the gas has a component of velocity VVV parallel to the shock.
